briefdescription.para: Enumerates the different abilities a character can have.
Hit Points.
Proficiency Bonus.
Armor Class.
Attack Bonus.
Damage Bonus.
Enumerates the different stats a character can possess.
Allows CharacterTest class to access private and protected members for testing purposes.
Current hit points of the character.
Level of the character.
Character's name.
Scores for the character's abilities.
Modifiers derived from the ability scores.
Map of character stats.
Currently equipped items.
Returns the default die type used for hit points calculation. Can be overridden by derived classes.

simplesect.para: DieType The default die type for the character.

briefdescription.para: Constructor that initializes a character with a name and level.

parameterdescription.para: The initial level of the character, clamped between 1 and 20.

briefdescription.para: Gets the character's name.

detaileddescription.para:
std::string The name of the character.
This function returns the name of the character. The name is used to identify the character in the game and does not affect any game mechanics.

briefdescription.para: Gets the character's current level.

detaileddescription.para:
int The current level of the character.
This function returns the character's level. Levels represent the character's progress and experience in the game. Higher levels typically indicate stronger characters.

briefdescription.para: Gets the score of a specific ability for the character.

detaileddescription.para:
ability
The ability for which the score is requested.
int The score of the specified ability.
This function returns the score for a specified ability. Ability scores determine the character's capabilities in various aspects such as strength, intelligence, and dexterity.

briefdescription.para: Gets the modifier for a specific ability for the character.

detaileddescription.para:
ability
The ability for which the modifier is requested.
int The modifier of the specified ability.
This function returns the modifier for a specified ability. Ability modifiers are derived from ability scores and are used in calculating the outcomes of actions that depend on the character's abilities.

briefdescription.para: Displays the character's stats to the standard output.
Returns the class name of the character. Allows for polymorphic behavior.

simplesect.para: std::string The class name of the character.

briefdescription.para: Equips an item to the character.

detaileddescription.para:
item
The item to be equipped.
This function equips an item to the character, potentially altering the character's ability scores and other statistics based on the item's properties. If the character already has an item equipped in the same slot, the behavior of this function is defined by the game mechanics (e.g., the previous item may need to be unequipped first).

briefdescription.para: Unequips an item from the character.

detaileddescription.para:
item
The item to be unequipped.
This function removes an item from the character's equipment, reversing any changes to the character's statistics that were made by equipping the item. If the item is not currently equipped, the function may simply do nothing or handle the situation as appropriate.

briefdescription.para: Displays the items currently equipped by the character.

detaileddescription.para: This function prints out a list of the items that the character is currently wearing, along with their stats or effects. This can be used to provide the player with an overview of their equipped items and their contributions to the character's abilities.

briefdescription.para: Gets the value of a specified stat for the character.

detaileddescription.para:
stats
The stat for which the value is requested.
int The value of the specified stat.
This function returns the current value of a specified stat (e.g., hit points, armor class). Stats are derived from the character's level, ability scores, and equipped items. This method allows querying the character's stats to determine their capabilities and status in the game.

briefdescription.para: Generates random ability scores for the character.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses dice rolls to randomly generate ability scores for the character.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the ability modifiers based on ability scores.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes each ability modifier as the floor of ((abilityScore - 10) / 2).

briefdescription.para: Recalculates ability scores and modifiers based on equipped items.

detaileddescription.para: Adjusts the character's ability scores and modifiers according to the stats of equipped items.

briefdescription.para: Reduces character's ability scores after unequipping an item.

detaileddescription.para:
item
The item being unequipped.
This function reduces the character's ability scores based on the item's stats.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the character's hit points based on level and Constitution modifier.

detaileddescription.para:
int The calculated hit points.
Calculates initial hit points using the character's die type and Constitution modifier.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the character's proficiency bonus based on their level.

detaileddescription.para:
int The calculated proficiency bonus.
Determines the proficiency bonus based on the character's level according to D&D rules.

briefdescription.para: Checks if an item is currently equipped.

detaileddescription.para:
item
The item to check.
true If the item is equipped, false otherwise.
Determines if the specified item is equipped by checking the wornItems map.

briefdescription.para: Checks if a given string corresponds to a valid ability.

simplesect.para: true if the string is a valid ability name, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Converts a string to its corresponding Ability enum.

detaileddescription.para:
str
The string to convert.
Ability The corresponding Ability enum.
Throws std::invalid_argument if the string does not correspond to a valid ability.

briefdescription.para: Converts a string to its corresponding Stats enum.

detaileddescription.para:
str
The string to convert.
Stats The corresponding Stats enum.
Throws std::invalid_argument if the string does not correspond to a valid stat.

briefdescription.para: The Character class represents an entity in the game with various attributes and behaviors.

detaileddescription.para: Represents a character in the game with abilities, stats, and equipped items.
Characters have abilities, levels, stats, and can equip items to modify their attributes. This class provides the basic functionality for managing a character's attributes and equipment.
This class manages the character's attributes such as name, level, ability scores, and equipped items. It includes functionalities for modifying these attributes and calculating derived statistics.
